message: One feature of Textmate that makes me come back to it is the ability to press ^H anywhere and have documentation for the word under that cursor. And that functionality is available in Ruby/PHP/CSS and many other languages. Is there a way to replicate that functionality in Vim?

There is a feature to get topical help, by pressing "K" while the cursor is on a word for which you want help. By default, it uses the man page lookup, but can be configured for any help lookup. There may be some work out there to support popular programming languages. I know I got a help manual for PHP that uses this method.
